text: George Jerome Waldo Goodman (August 10, 1930 â€“ January 3, 2014) was an American author and economics commentator. He was best known by his pen name Adam Smith. He also wrote fiction under his real name. Goodman died at the age of 83, at the University of Miami Hospital. He had suffered from the bone marrow disorder myelofibrosis. ==References== ==Other websites== * Goodman's bio at Bookrags.com, page 1 * Goodman's bio at Bookrags.com, page 2 * Category:1930 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Writers from St. Louis, Missouri Category:Deaths from myelofibrosis
title: George Goodman
